skillGroups.title: Operating with Exponents
skillGroups.description: Exponent rules of multiplication and division

skillGroups.title: Equation of a Relation and the Shape of its Graph
Perimeter Area Surface Area and Volume

skills.title: Exponent Basics
skills.description: Evaluate expressions involving natural-number exponents with rational-number bases

skills.title: Length, area, and volume using exponents
skills.description: [i.e., length, which is one dimensional, can be represented by x ; area, which is two dimensional, can be represented by (x)(x) or x2; volume, which is three dimensional, can be represented by (x)(x)(x),(x2)(x), or x3 ]

skills.title: Exponent rules for multiplication and division
skills.description: apply these rules in expressions involving one and two variables with positive exponents

skills.title: Power of a power rule
skills.description: apply it to simplify expressions involving one and two variables with positive exponents

skills.title: Simplify Numerical Expressions
skills.description: simplify numerical expressions involving integers and rational numbers, with and without the use of technology

skills.title: Percent, Ratio, Rate, and Proportion
skills.description: Solve problems requiring the manipulation of expressions arising from applications of percent, ratio, rate, and proportion

skills.title: Square and Square Root
skills.description: relate their understanding of inverse operations to squaring and taking the square root, and apply inverse operations to simplify expressions and solve equations

skills.title: Add and Subtract Polynomials
skills.description: add and subtract polynomials with up to two variables [e.g., (2x – 5) + (3x + 1), (3x2y + 2xy2) + (4x2y – 6xy2)], using a variety of tools (e.g., algebra tiles, computer algebra systems, paper and pencil)

skills.title: Multiply Polynomial and Monomial
skills.description: multiply a polynomial by a monomial involving the same variable [e.g., 2x(x + 4),2x2(3x2 – 2x + 1)], using a variety of tools (e.g., algebra tiles, diagrams,computer algebra systems, paper and pencil)

skills.title: Simplify Polynomials
skills.description: expand and simplify polynomial expressions involving one variable [e.g., 2x(4x + 1) – 3x(x + 2)], using a variety of tools (e.g., algebra tiles, computer algebra systems, paper and pencil)

skills.title: First Degree Equations
skills.description: solve first-degree equations, including equations with fractional coefficients, using a variety of tools (e.g., computer algebra systems, paper and pencil) and strategies(e.g., the balance analogy, algebraic strategies)

skills.title: Rearranging Formulas
skills.description: rearrange formulas involving variables in the first degree, with and without substitution (e.g., in analytic geometry, in measurement) ( Sample problem: A circular garden has a circumference of 30 m. What is the length of a straight path that goes through the centre of this garden?)

skills.title: Solving Problems
skills.description: solve problems that can be modelled with first-degree equations, and compare algebraic methods to other solution methods (Sample problem: Solve the following problem in more than one way: Jonah is involved in a walkathon. His goal is to walk 25 km. He begins at 9:00 a.m. and walks at a steady rate of 4 km/h. How many kilometres does he still have left to walk at 1:15 p.m. if he is to achieve his goal?

NA1-01.title: Exponent Basics
NA1-01.description: You should be able to evaluate expressions involving natural-number exponents with rational-number bases

NA1-02.title: Length, area, and volume using exponents
NA1-02.description: Length, which is one dimensional, can be represented by x ; area, which is two dimensional, can be represented by (x)(x) or x^2; volume, which is three dimensional, can be represented by (x)(x)(x),(x2)(x), or x^3

NA1-03.title: Exponent rules for multiplication and division
NA1-03.description: Apply these rules in expressions involving one and two variables with positive exponents

NA1-04.title: Exponent rules for power of power
NA1-04.description: Apply it to simplify expressions involving one and two variables with positive exponents

NA2-01.title: Simplify Numerical Expressions
NA2-01.description: Simplify numerical expressions involving integers and rational numbers, with and without the use of technology

NA2-02.title: Percent, Ratio, Rate, and Proportion
NA2-02.description: Solve problems requiring the manipulation of expressions arising from applications of percent, ratio, rate, and proportion

NA2-03.title: Square and Square Root
NA2-03.description: Relate their understanding of inverse operations to squaring and taking the square root, and apply inverse operations to simplify expressions and solve equations

NA2-04.title: Add and Subtract Polynomials
NA2-04.description: Add and subtract polynomials with up to two variables [e.g., (2x – 5) + (3x + 1), (3x2y + 2xy2) + (4x2y – 6xy2)], using a variety of tools (e.g., algebra tiles, computer algebra systems, paper and pencil)

NA2-05.title: Multiply Polynomial and Monomial
NA2-05.description: Multiply a polynomial by a monomial involving the same variable [e.g., 2x(x + 4),2x2(3x2 – 2x + 1)], using a variety of tools (e.g., algebra tiles, diagrams,computer algebra systems, paper and pencil)

NA2-06.title: Simplify Polynomials
NA2-06.description: Expand and simplify polynomial expressions involving one variable [e.g., 2x(4x + 1) – 3x(x + 2)], using a variety of tools (e.g., algebra tiles, computer algebra systems, paper and pencil)

NA2-07.title: First Degree Equations
NA2-07.description: Solve first-degree equations, including equations with fractional coefficients, using a variety of tools (e.g., computer algebra systems, paper and pencil) and strategies(e.g., the balance analogy, algebraic strategies)

NA2-08.title: Rearranging Formulas
NA2-08.description: Rearrange formulas involving variables in the first degree, with and without substitution (e.g., in analytic geometry, in measurement) ( Sample problem: A circular garden has a circumference of 30 m. What is the length of a straight path that goes through the centre of this garden?)

NA2-09.title: Solving Problems
NA2-09.description: solve problems that can be modelled with first-degree equations, and compare algebraic methods to other solution methods (Sample problem: Solve the following problem in more than one way: Jonah is involved in a walkathon. His goal is to walk 25 km. He begins at 9:00 a.m. and walks at a steady rate of 4 km/h. How many kilometres does he still have left to walk at 1:15 p.m. if he is to achieve his goal?

NA1-02.question: What is the volume of a cube (V = s^3) with a side length of 4
What is the area of a square (A = s^2) with a side length of 8
What is the volume of a cylinder (V = h * pi * r^2) with a height of 10 and radius of 5

NA1-03.question: If 2^a * 2^b = 64, then what are possible values for a and b?
